alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 4:18PM EDT until July 05 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Clay and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ammie, Teges, Oneida, Hensley, Seth, Wild Cat, Felty, Barcreek, Newfound, Tanksley, Trixie, Thomas, Spurlock, Mill Pond, Laurel Creek, Mistletoe, Bernice, Brutus, Treadway and Sextons Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
